definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
oriental cherry (Prunus serrulata or Prunus yedoensis), prized for its blossom/also known as sakura (Japanese) or Yoshino cherry
Sakurajima, an active volcano in Kagoshima prefecture, Japan
The Cherry Orchard, a play by Chekhov 契訶夫|契诃夫[Qi4 he1 fu1]
see 櫻桃小嘴|樱桃小嘴[ying1 tao2 xiao3 zui3]
lit. cherry mouth (idiom)/fig. a delicate, ruby-lipped mouth
see 聖女果|圣女果[sheng4 nu:3 guo3]
ancient spear-like weapon, decorated with a red tassel

sentences.english: It tends to have a mellow bouquet and excellent aroma, with golden leaf of SAKURA flower.
sentences.chinese: 优雅的香味，芳醇的美味，含有樱花瓣形的金片。

sentences.english: Spring has begun, and so has Japan's obsession with cherry blossoms。
sentences.chinese: 春天来了，日本各地的赏樱热潮也开始了。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, more and more is also anchorage autumn sakura relationship to the soul.
sentences.chinese: 同时阿基和秋樱关系也越来越甘美。

sentences.english: After small wind into rotary met second-year autumn sakura learn elder sister.
sentences.chinese: 入社后小风认识了二年级的秋樱学姐。

sentences.english: "Happy, from this moment" is Double Cherry's conception.
sentences.chinese: “幸福，从这一刻开始”是八重樱奉行不渝的理念。

sentences.english: The cherry blossom trees were flying their light pink petals slowly, just like a dream. Everything seemed so quiet and still.
sentences.chinese: 淡粉色樱花瓣缓缓的从樱花树上飘扬，就像一个梦。

definition: Matsushima (name)/Matsushima town and national park in Miyagi prefecture, Japan
(phonetic character used in transliteration of foreign names)/Taiwan pr. [li4]/variant of 璃[li2]
